StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertMudRegion]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @FIPS varchar(5), @State varchar(2) ) AS
IF NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [dbo].[MUD_STAGING] WHERE FIPS = @FIPS) BEGIN
IF (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT [DIST_NAME]) FROM dbo.MUD_REGIONS WHERE [STATE] = @State) = 1 BEGIN -- The State is completely run by 1 District. Assign it to the District. INSERT INTO [dbo].[MUD_REGIONS] ( FIPS, STATE, REGION_NAME, REGION_ID, DIST_NAME, DIST_ID, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE ) SELECT @FIPS, @State, REGION_NAME, REGION_ID, DIST_NAME, DIST_ID, 'USPS', GetDate() FROM dbo.MUD_REGIONS WHERE [STATE] = @State END ELSE IF (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT [REGION_NAME]) FROM dbo.MUD_REGIONS WHERE [STATE] = @State) = 1 BEGIN -- The State is completely run by 1 Region, but is split at the District level. Just assign it to the Region. INSERT INTO [dbo].[MUD_REGIONS] ( FIPS, STATE, REGION_NAME, REGION_ID, DIST_NAME, DIST_ID, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE ) SELECT @FIPS, @State, REGION_NAME, REGION_ID, NULL, NULL, 'USPS', GetDate() FROM dbo.MUD_REGIONS WHERE [STATE] = @State END ELSE BEGIN -- The State is split at the Region level. Assign to the Eastern Region by default. INSERT INTO [dbo].[MUD_REGIONS] ( FIPS, STATE, REGION_NAME, REGION_ID, DIST_NAME, DIST_ID, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE ) SELECT @FIPS, @State, 'E', 901, NULL, NULL, 'USPS', GetDate() FROM dbo.MUD_REGIONS WHERE [STATE] = @State END
END
